headline.main: U. S. SPEEDS ENTRY OF JAPAN IN GATT

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 9--The State Department said today the new tariff agreements with Japan would strengthen that country's economic ties with the free world. They will also reduce the danger that Japan will become dependent on trade with Communist...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 9--The State Department said today the new tariff agreements with Japan would strengthen that country's economic ties with the free world. They will also reduce the danger that Japan will become dependent on trade with Communist China, according to the department.
docs.abstract: US sees dependence on USSR bloc trade lessened by GATT membership

headline.main: TARIFF TIE CALLED BOON TO JAPANESE; State Department Says GATT Cuts Nation's Dependence on Trade With Reds

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 16 -- Armed revolt flashed out against President Juan D. Peron today and bombs rained on the Government House area in two air raids. Tonight the President declared the rebellion had been put down.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 17 (AP) -- Following are the texts of a translation of a speech in Spanish by President Juan D. Peron to the Argentine people today and of Army communiques on the Argentine revolt:
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 17 (AP) -- Following are the texts of a translation of a speech in Spanish by President Juan D. Peron to the Argentine people today and of Army communiques on the Argentine revolt:

headline.main: Texts of Speech by Peron and Communiques From the Army

docs.snippet: It is clear that the revolt in Argentina is failing. Temporarily, at least, President Peron seems stronger than ever. A wave of persecution and arrests must be expected. Nothing has been gained and much appears to have been lost. However, in the long...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is clear that the revolt in Argentina is failing. Temporarily, at least, President Peron seems stronger than ever. A wave of persecution and arrests must be expected. Nothing has been gained and much appears to have been lost. However, in the long run it may well prove that the Peronist regime has been weakened, for this was a serious uprising, involving high naval and air force officers who were giving expression to deep-seated disaffection.
docs.abstract: ed sees Peron temporarily stronger than ever; hold opponents gained nothing, lost much in revolt; decries attempts to link Ch to revolt; scorns Gordon appraisal of Peron regime

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 17 -- Peace returned to this city today after yesterday's bloody revolt had been crushed.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 17 -- Peace returned to this city today after yesterday's bloody revolt had been crushed.
docs.abstract: peace restored; fighting illus; Peron warns nation is in state of siege, radio s; blames Communists for acts against chs; says Army and police will guarantee order; holds revolt directed wholly against self and Casa Rosada; lays his escape to intelligence service warning; admits Ch dispute's link to revolt; denies fighting religion; urges pub await Const Assembly election to solve ch-state issue; urges priests help restore calm; police rept 156 dead, 846 wounded, 96 seriously; BA Nacion repts 360 dead; 1st eyewitness rept says mobs fired almost every RC ch in Downtown BA; flights around or over BA barred; Govt radio repeatedly stresses nation is calm, but Casa Rosada area is declared mil zone; press photos show bomb damage; Noticias Graficas repts Army controls submarine base, Mar del Plata; repts Radio Mitre captured for 3 hrs by rebels, reptdly aided by 50 Cath Action members; US Embassy evacuates 54 Amers from hotel in Plaza de Mayo area

headline.main: PERON ASKS CALM, SAYS COMMUNISTS SET CHURCH FIRES; Nation Is in a State of Siege, He Warns -- Police Put Dead in Rebellion at 156 BUENOS AIRES IS QUIET Almost All Religious Edifices Reported Burned -- Flights Over Capital Banned Argentina Surveys Destruction After Uprising -- Government and Religious Buildings Alike Are Damaged PERON ASKS CALM, HE ACCUSES REDS
